Text: Violet...?!
Oh, I recognize you from before...
Long time no see.

(...Huh? Do these two know each other? Never would've
expected that.)
So, why are you here, Violet?

I don't quite know myself... Perhaps this event has
something to do with it.

It's as if these odd sounds and lights beckoned me.
And then I was here, and I found you two.
Oh...

(Wait, doesn't Obon have something to with ancestors
coming back to visit?)
(Maybe that's why Violet was drawn here, too.)

(Aw man, they didn't have to copy that part, too!
Guessing they probably didn't mean to, though!)
Do you have any idea as to why, good sir?
Nope, not at all. No way I'd know anything.
Hehe, well, I'll take your word for it.

At any rate, I'm here. But I'm afraid my little
trip astray is temporary... I can't stay here
forever.
You have to go back right away?

Well, I don't know. Personally, I'd like to have a
little fun first, since I'm here and all.

(She sure doesn't seem too concerned... Not that it
has anything to do with me, though.)
Okay, well, enjoy the summer festival.

My, what a cold thing to say. I'd say it's fate that
we met here. What's the harm in having a look around
together?
Huh...?

Now wait just a moment. You say it's fate that you
met here. Well, I believe that it's fate that I
encountered him as well.

Being unfamiliar with modern customs as I am...I was
hoping you would show me around, my dear sir. Please,
won't you honor me with your company?

Uhhh... Personally, I think we should all go our
separate ways. We'd stick out like a sore thumb as a
group...

You have a point... But I think more good would come
of us being together.
I dunno about that...

You don't see it? There are many souls of the
departed gathering in the area. I'm sure they were
drawn here like me.

I don't think anyone has noticed yet...but if these
souls remain here, I can imagine it might lead to
trouble.

So what you're saying is...they could turn into
evil spirits or something?

Yes, that's highly likely. If all the souls that have
wandered were to turn malevolent and lash out...I'm
certain the damage would be grievous.
There's that many of them?

They're everywhere. There, you see? That man over
there is one...

(He looks pretty normal at a glance... But I do kinda
pick up something weird about his magic. Maybe he's a
dead soul.)

It's as you say. I can tell that the gentleman over
there is not a normal person as well.

The souls don't seem harmful for the moment... But if
they continue to gather unabated, they will
eventually change for the worse.

Correct. The living and dead can't intermingle. For
the attachments of the dead are toxic to the living.

Besides, all they did was get lost. It's so sad to
see them tormented by their lingering regrets toward
life simply because of that.

So I was thinking it might be best to speak with them
so that they can return to where they belong. And
enjoy the festival while we do, naturally.
Got it. I understand the situation now.

...But it's that last part that you really care
about, right?

No, that's not true. But doesn't it make more sense
to enjoy ourselves if we're going to be doing the
same thing anyway?

(I understand the situation...but not gonna lie,
it doesn't seem like there's much in it for me.)

I will assist you. This is festival is so wonderful,
after all. Enjoying it to the end together sounds
like a fine idea.

(They could probably handle any fighting on their
own, too...)
(...Hold on a sec.)

(A festival is underway, peaceful and without
incident...except behind it all unfolds a epic battle
against ghosts! That totally sounds like a
shadowbroker scenario!)

(I can even look on from my hidden vantage point at
all those happy families talking about how fun this
all is! Hell yeah...!)
Okay, okay, I'll help, too.
Hehe, I had a feeling you'd say that.
Marvelous, good sir. You are so kind.
Alright, now let's go see the festival.
(Let the secret ghost-busting mission begin!)
